mapper.select:
select ur.role_id, ud.dept_id || '-' || ud.post_id dept_post_id, t.parent_id,
from hub_user u left join hub_user_role ur on u.user_id = ur.user_id left join hub_user_dept ud on u.user_id = ud.user_id left join hub_user_diagram t on u.user_id = t.user_id and t.parent_id > 0 where u.tenant_id = #{tenantId} and u.user_id = #{userId}
mapper.insert:
insert into hub_user(tenant_id, user_type, user_code, user_name, user_account, user_passwd, user_sex, user_phone, user_email, user_status, remark, create_by, update_by, create_time, update_time ) values
(#{item.tenantId}, #{item.userType}, #{item.userCode}, #{item.userName}, #{item.userAccount}, #{item.userPasswd}, #{item.userSex}, #{item.userPhone}, #{item.userEmail}, #{item.userStatus}, #{item.remark}, #{item.createBy}, #{item.createBy}, #{item.createTime}, #{item.createTime})
on conflict do nothing
on conflict do update set user_name = excluded.user_name, user_sex = excluded.user_sex, user_phone = excluded.user_phone, user_email = excluded.user_email, user_status = excluded.user_status, remark = excluded.remark, update_user = excluded.update_user, update_dept = excluded.update_dept, update_time = excluded.update_time
mapper.select: with recursive tree (user_id, parent_id) as (select t1.user_id, t1.parent_id from hub_user_diagram t1 where user_id = #{userId} union select t2.user_id, t2.parent_id from hub_user_diagram t2 join tree on t2.parent_id = tree.user_id) select distinct tree.user_id from tree JOIN hub_user u on tree.user_id = u.user_id

select t.user_id id, t.parent_id pid, u.user_name as label, u.user_rank userRank from hub_user_diagram t left join hub_user u ON t.user_id = u.user_id where t.tenant_id = #{tenantId} order by t.parent_id, t.user_id

select u.user_id userId, u.user_name userName from hub_user_dept ud inner join (select dept_id from hub_user_dept where user_id = #{userId} and is_default = 1) as d on ud.dept_id = d.dept_id inner join hub_user u on ud.user_id = u.user_id where ud.is_leader = 1 and u.tenant_id = #{tenantId}

select u.user_id, u.user_type, u.user_account, u.user_name, u.user_email, u.user_phone, u.user_sex, u.user_code, u.create_time, u.mfa, r.role_name, d.dept_name || '/' || p.post_name deptName, pu.user_name parentName from hub_user u left join hub_user_role ur on u.user_id = ur.user_id left join hub_role r on ur.role_id = r.role_id left join hub_user_dept ud on u.user_id = ud.user_id left join hub_dept d on ud.dept_id = d.dept_id left join hub_post p on ud.post_id = p.post_id left join hub_user_diagram t on u.user_id = t.user_id left join hub_user pu on t.parent_id = pu.user_id where u.user_id = #{userId}

select u.tenant_id tenantId, u.user_id userId, u.user_name userName, u.user_account userAccount, u.create_time createTime, u.update_time updateTime from hub_user u join hub_user_role ur on u.user_id = ur.user_id join hub_role r on ur.role_id = r.role_id where u.tenant_id = #{tenantId} and r.role_code = 'sysAdmin'
